results.title: Researching the topic
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Finding out”.
Demonstrates the principles of student research through the experiences of a secondary student who is required to do a research project on any aspect of “people and work”. As the practicalities of the task are confronted the audience is guided through the key stages of project planning, information collection and processing, formulating conclusions and presentation. Accompanied by 13p Teacher Notes.

results.title: Preparing and conducting an interview
results.creator_credit: Justin Shortal and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Finding out”.
Kylie’s class has been set the task of recording an interview with an aspect of their own choice. We follow Kylie’s progress as she moves through a process of preparing and conducting an interview.

results.title: Greenhouse effect: we can all make a difference
results.brief_description: An animated collage of fast-moving images which focuses on the problems of the Green-house effect and what solutions can be tried. Would provide an interesting starting point for discussion with upper primary/lower secondary students.

results.title: Soil Conservation District: Jerramungup
results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Describes how each committee member deals with a land degredation problem. Problems discussed and projects undertaken: wind erosion, tree and saltbush planting, direct drilling research, reduction of salinity and waterlogging in catchment area, growing of lucerne to reduce saline watertable.

results.title: Soil structure decline
results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: After a short period of cultivationn, our soils are losing their inherent structure and are becoming difficult to work. This program discusses soil structure decline and its effect on agricultural productivity.

results.title: Conservation cropping
results.creator_credit: Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: This compilation tape specifically targets the wheat and sheep area of the Mallee Region and looks at ways that soil erosion can be avoided. The four episodes shown are: “Trash is treasure.”, Blade aid”, “Croppers” and “Mallee Modifiers.

results.title: Rabbit control. Part 2: follow up
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a programme designed to control the rabbit population and their adverse effects on farming. This episode, which is narrated by Maurie Fields, looks at fumigation, destruction of habitat, baiting and shooting with follow-up procedures to ensure successful control of rabbit populations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land

results.title: Rabbit Control [Part 1: Poisoning with 1080]
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.

results.title: Just a patch of scrub
results.creator_credit: World Wide Fund for Nature Australia
results.brief_description: Overviews traditional problems with the land including clearing, soil erosion and salinity. Discusses the importance of preserving and benefits of remnant native vegetation and shows the revegatation of a wasteland area where land had been cleared. Includes comprehensive teaching notes.
